tournament.name: Red Bull Untapped International Qualifier II

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to slow down the game and eventually overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Shark Typhoon and Expansion / Explosion. The mana base provides a good mix of colors to support the control strategy, while also including cards like Scorching Dragonfire and Aether Gust to deal with various types of threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Wilderness Reclamation and card advantage to control the game through countering spells and board wipes. It aims to generate a large amount of mana and use it to cast powerful spells such as Shark Typhoon and Expansion/Explosion. The deck also includes powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure while maintaining control. Additionally, the deck includes Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through removal spells and counter spells, while also ramping up mana to play powerful threats such as Nissa, Ugin, and Hydroid Krasis. With Teferi to disrupt the opponent's plays and Jolrael to create token blockers, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and win through card advantage. Sublime Epiphany provides versatility and Shark Typhoon can create tokens to finish off the opponent. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, ensuring smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells and removal spells. It also aims to ramp up mana quickly to cast powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Hydroid Krasis. Utilizing cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Growth Spiral, the deck aims to accelerate its mana base and take advantage of the card advantage provided by cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also has a token-generating finisher in Shark Typhoon to close out the game.

The key strategy of this deck is to maintain constant pressure on the opponent by utilizing sacrifice effects and small, recurring creatures to chip away at their life total while generating value from sacrificing creatures. This aggressive approach is supplemented by cards like Dreadhorde Butcher and Mayhem Devil to maximize damage output and punish opponents for blocking or removing your creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently through a combination of aggression and synergistic interactions.

The main concept of this Temur Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through card advantage and tempo plays. By utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to control the board with counterspells and removal spells, ultimately creating a powerful board presence with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher. With access to powerful removal, card draw, and counterspells, the deck seeks to outgrind opponents and secure victory through incremental advantages and overwhelming late-game threats.

The main focus of this deck is to take control of the game by utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and tempo advantage. The deck aims to counter opponent's spells with cards like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust, while also having removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower. Nightpack Ambusher provides threat on the board while also generating wolves, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and lifegain. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient spellcasting and strategic board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various means such as countering opponent's spells, generating card advantage, and stabilizing with powerful threats. The deck utilizes Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to ramp up quickly, while also utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shark Typhoon to control the board and generate value. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The goal is to establish board control and finish the game with a powerful Expansion/Explosion or Shark Typhoon.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a flying creature presence on the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive flying attacks. By combining cheap flying creatures like Healer's Hawk and Faerie Miscreant with anthem effects like Empyrean Eagle and Skycat Sovereign, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Rally of Wings and Sephara, Sky's Blade provide additional ways to boost the power of the flying creatures and close out games efficiently. The inclusion of counterspells like Lofty Denial helps protect the creatures and maintain board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, alongside board wipes such as Shatter the Sky. It also aims to generate card advantage and maintain board presence with cards like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck is designed to outvalue the opponent through efficient removal, card draw, and ramp, ultimately leading to a strong late-game advantage and the ability to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with removal spells like Shatter the Sky. The deck also includes cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to provide value and pressure the opponent. The mana base is built around consistently casting the powerful spells in the deck, with a mix of lands that fix mana and provide different colors. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through proactive control strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump effects, utilizing efficient green creatures like Questing Beast, Scavenging Ooze, and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Llanowar Visionary and The Great Henge. The powerful planeswalkers Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional support and synergy with the rest of the deck. Overall, the deck's goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful spells. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell boosts the damage output of all red sources, while Anax, Hardened in the Forge creates tokens upon dying. Embercleave provides a powerful finishing blow, and Light Up the Stage helps maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Castle Embereth and a high number of Mountains ensures a consistent flow of red mana for casting spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining pressure on the opponent and overwhelming them before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total. The creatures in the deck are all low to the ground, enabling quick plays and early damage. Key cards such as Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave enhance the deck's aggression and damage output. The deck aims to control the board early on and finish the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through card draw and mana acceleration. The goal is to establish a strong board presence with Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon, while using counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust to protect your key cards. Expansion / Explosion provides a versatile win condition, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath helps with card advantage and life gain. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and gradually overwhelm them with powerful spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, land manipulation, and powerful spells to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to establish a strong mana base with Wilderness Reclamation and generate card advantage through Growth Spiral and Castle Vantress. Nightpack Ambusher provides a threat that can quickly take over the game, while Shark Typhoon can create a steady stream of threats. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with threats as needed.
